lexUnit.name: tragedy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an event causing great suffering, destruction, and distress

sentence.text: ` It 's a tragedy that all those millions of pounds of investment are not going to create many jobs .
It was only on the second and third day after the tragedy that the family slowly began to realise how many other people had been sitting around in shocked disbelief at the news .
It is a tragedy that many children have been denied the chance to take these tests .

Mr Gandhi 's murder is a new and testing tragedy .
It is a double tragedy for the family . "
This has to be a tragedy for everyone involved . )

And while we 're on the subject , Rachel , what did you mean the other night when you said the real tragedy for anyone facing up to a handicap was when expected support was withdrawn ? "

The biggest tragedy is that the problems do n't go away ; they only grow .

She bore upon her aquiline and emaciated face the traces of some recent tragedy .
